result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas T Magaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nickolas T Magaw is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nickolas T Magaw was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
29 days credit granted

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to the poster.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the Village of Pewaukee Police Department

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment. 

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

No new law violations
Maintain/obtain full-time employment (35hrs per week) within the first 30 days of release

timeConds.notes: Huber with release for work, work search, child care, treatment and the victim impact panel. Commences forthwith.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:13 PM Defendant Nickolas T Magaw in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Nickolas T Magaw.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
42 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 29 days if revoked)
-	18 Months of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program if revoked
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program if revoked

DL REVOCATION:  27 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 27 months.

Term of Probation:2 Years
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within  the first 30 days of release;
-	No new law violations;

Condition Time: 150 Days Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH, CHILD CARE, TREATMENT AND THE VICTIM IMPACT PANEL - To commence forthwith. 

FINE:  $ 1582.00

IID Surcharge: $ 50.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $ 35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Pewaukee Village Police Department.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 20 months of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 

AODA Assessment and follow through

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS after court today.

08:26 AM Defendant Nickolas T Magaw in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  The Court addresses the two WCS non-compliance reports.  The State takes no position.  Attorney Wolff makes statements regarding the defendant's WCS non-compliance and is asking for the Court to admonish the defendant.  The Court admonishes the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
